page.title: 08EVENTS : SWANSEA WEST
page.content:
School fetes are popular money-making events. They include bizarre activities such as welly-throwing competitions,and at Hendrefoilan School there is a stall where wet sponges are thrown at a teacher.
One Saturday in June 1985, All Souls Brownies went to Cwrt Sart School, Neath where they took part in singing and other activities to celebrate 75 years of the Girl Guide Movement. There are also Scouts,Cub Scouts,Air Cadets and the Boys' Brigade in our area.
Other events include Cockett Festival,garden parties and fun runs, all of which are held annually.
